public class zeta.content.zirp.Type

(source file: Type.pizza)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.content.zirp.Type
The pure class interface. 
public class Type
Type annotation slot and auxilary methods for types. This slot is provided at all Expr terms if the syntax is context-checked. A type is represented as an expression of a restricted form, which matches one of the following patterns: 
      Expr.Variable(NameAppl(Name, {Type1,...,TypeN}))
      Expr.Product({Type1,...,TypeN})
      Expr.Signature(_,{Type1,...,TypeN})
      Expr.Unary(Expr.UnaryKind.Power,Type)
where TypeI is a type expression again, and Name refers to a given type.

Furthermore, types may contain unification variables (Expr.UniVar), yet these do not appear in annotations of type-checked expressions.

In contrast to normal expressions, the expressions used for type annotations do not have annotations again.

Author:
Wolfgang Grieskamp (wg@cs.tu-berlin.de)
Version: $Id: Type.pizza,v 1.5 2000/05/08 07:07:43 wg Exp $

Type
public Type();

slot
public static final Slot slot;
The slot object.

anyType

public static final Variable anyType;
A constant for representing "any" type (error type) in types.

put
public static void put(Annotation an,
                       Expr type);
Set value of type annotation slot.

Parameters:
an - the annotation
type - the expression representing the type. This should be a valid type expression as explained above (no automatic consistency checks are currently made).

get

public static Expr get(Annotation an);
Get value of type annotation slot.

Parameters:
an - the annotation
Returns:
the type, or null, if no one is provided.

isProvided

public static boolean isProvided(Annotation an);
Test whether type annotation slot is provided.

Parameters:
an - the annotation
Returns:
true if the type annotation slot is provided

makeGiven

public static Expr makeGiven(Name name);
Make a given type expression. Returns an expression of form Expr.Variable(NameAppl(Name,{}).

makeGenGiven

public static Expr makeGenGiven(Name name,
                                Expr[] actuals);
Make a generic given type expression. Returns an expression of form Expr.Variable(NameAppl(Name,Generics).

makePower

public static Expr makePower(Expr type);
Make a powerset type expression. Returns an expression of form Expr.Unary(Expr.UnaryKind.Power,Type).

makeProduct

public static Expr makeProduct(Expr[] components);
Make a product type expression. Returns an expression of form Expr.Product({Type1,...,TypeN})

makeSignature

public static Expr makeSignature(Name[] names,
                                 Expr[] types);
Make a signature type expression. Returns an expression of form Expr.Signature({Name1,...,NameN},{Type1,...,TypeN})

makeVar

public static Expr makeVar(Name name);
Make a free type variable expression. Returns an expression of form Expr.UniVar(Name, null).

substitute

public static Expr substitute(Expr type,
                              Name[] names,
                              Expr[] types);
Substitute in type the given names by the given types.

toPrettyFormat

public static Format toPrettyFormat(Expr type);
Pretty-print the given type expression

unify

public static void unify(Expr l,
                         Expr r)
  throws UnificationFailure;
Unify the two types. Throws exception if unification fails.

Type variables (Expr.UniVar) will be bound by the unification algorithm. The special type anyType, if apppearing in some of the type terms, will be treated.

private static class Substitutor
private static class Substitutor
  extends TermVisitor
Term visitor class for substitution.

public static class UnificationFailure

public static class UnificationFailure
  extends Exception
Exception class representing a unification failure, holding the critical pair where the unification failed.
